citRespParty.rpOrgName: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Ocean and Coastal Resource Management (OCRM), National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)
NOAA's Ocean Service, National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The MPA Inventory is a comprehensive catalog that provides detailed information for existing marine protected areas in the United States. The inventory provides geospatial boundary information (in polygon format) and classification attributes that seek to define the conservation objectives, protection level, governance and related management criteria for all sites in the database. The comprehensive inventory of federal, state and territorial MPA sites provides governments and stakeholders with access to information to make better decisions about the current and future use of place-based conservation. The information also will be used to inform the development of the national system of marine protected areas as required by Executive Order 13158.

In addition to those MPAs included in the National MPA Inventory, 3 additional areas were added by NOAA Fisheries since all three restrict commercial fishing. These include the state territorial seas of Washington and California, and the NMFS trawl rockfish conservation area (RCA) between the 100- and 150-ftm RCA boundaries. Other differences between this data layer and the one published originally by NOAA's Marine Protected Areas Center include the addition of several attribute fields to better describe what commercial gear types are or are not prohibited in these MPAs. See a description of fields in this metadata record.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The inventory represents a collection of data compiled from various federal, state, tribal and territorial entities to provide a publicly available source of comprehensive information on place-based marine conservation efforts under U.S. federal, state, territorial, local, and tribal jurisdiction.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: NOAA Marine Protected Areas Center in joint effort with the US Department of the Interior

idPoC.rpOrgName: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Ocean and Coastal Resource Management (OCRM), National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)

LegConsts.useLimit: See access and use constraints information.

Consts.useLimit: These data are in the Public domain. The data are not to be used for navigation. For more information, see the accuracy section.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: This dataset consists of original boundaries as represented by the managing agencies, including any terrestrial components of the protected areas. Only the sub-tidal components of the areas meet the definition of an MPA. Version Notes: 2012: This version contains boundary updates during the 2011 calendar year. Boundaries were added for new MPAs created in California. Boundaries were updated for National Park Service, National Marine Fisheries Service, Washington, Virgin Islands and Wisconsin sites in the MPA Inventory. 2011: This version contains boundary updates during the 2010 calendar year. Boundaries were added for new MPAs created in California. Boundaries for Hawaii, American Samoa, Florida and National Marine Fisheries Service MPAs were added for sites already in the MPA Inventory. All National Park Service and National Estuarine Research Reserve and some National Wildlife Refuge boundaries were updated with original data. 2010: This version contains boundaries for all sites from authoritative sources as updated between 6/2009-12/2009. New data have been added for multiple states and territories, including Alaska, Florida, Maryland, North Carolina, New Hampshire, Ohio, Pennsylvania, US Virgin Islands and Wisconsin. Numerous shipwreck sites represented as latitude/longitude coordinate points were converted to polygons using a 300-meter radius buffer. NMFS sites have been verified against US Code of Federal Regulations.
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000

prcStep.stepDesc: All data were reprojected to WGS 1984, decimal degrees.

GIS data for all sites were collected from authoritative sources. Data were either downloaded from public websites, requested directly from MPA managers or digitized based on legal definitions (eg US Code of Federal Regulations).
All site data were merged into a single shapefile.
MPA Inventory attribute data were appended to shapefile.
MPA Inventory shapefile was dissolved to one multipart polygon per site
All sites were reviewed by MPA Center to ensure a match between GIS data and MPA Inventory description.
